glsa.title: Crypt::CBC: Insecure initialization vector
glsa.synopsis: Crypt::CBC uses an insecure initialization vector, potentially resulting in a weaker encryption.

background.p: Crypt::CBC is a Perl module to encrypt data using cipher block chaining (CBC).

description.p: Lincoln Stein discovered that Crypt::CBC fails to handle 16 bytes long initializiation vectors correctly when running in the RandomIV mode, resulting in a weaker encryption because the second part of every block will always be encrypted with zeros if the blocksize of the cipher is greater than 8 bytes.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit weak ciphertext produced by Crypt::CBC to bypass certain security restrictions or to gain access to sensitive data.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
